title: PBM joins hands with NSER to strengthen framework
content:
ISLAMABAD, Dec 16 (APP): Pakistan Bait-ul-Maal (PBM) and National Socio Economic Registry (NSER) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) in order to utilize the data of under privileged people adequately for their assistance.
Managing Director (MD) of PBM Amir Fida Paracha, and DG National Socio Economic Registry (NSER), Dr Naveed Akbar were present at the signing of this agreement.
MD Amir Fida Paracha acknowledged this progressive step as a significant milestone in institutional partnership and expressed gratitude to Chairman Benazir Income Support Program, Dr. Amjad Saqib, for the collaboration and cooperation.
It is to mention here that the Benazir Income Support Program (BISP) has organized data of individuals living below the poverty line through third-party surveys nationwide, which will now be accessible to Pakistan Bait-ul-Mal under this agreement.
This will not only boost the morale of those receiving dual assistance but will also assist in identifying eligible individuals.
Moreover, Pakistan Bait-ul-Mal will be connected with the National Socioeconomic Registry (NSER) system of BISP and its field staff will also be able to conduct surveys to identify eligible individuals when necessary, using tabs directly linked with NSER data.
